description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
species of individuals participating in the study - chimpanzee
name of the two participants that compose the dyad
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical

focal first = the focal participant chooses one side before the platform goes to the other cage. Competitor first = the focal chooses one side after the platform has been on the other side (whether or not a competitor is present (social) or not (nonsocial) -  see below)

social = the competitor is present on the other side- non-social = there is no competitor present- that cage is empty. Half of the focal participants started in the social group- the other half in the non-social group.

pellet picture = focal participant chose the container with the picture of pellets- empty picture = focal participant chose the container with the picture of nothing (focal did not see pictures when choosing but had to remember the locations from the baiting)
